int_who_info: Experimental school (E) participants received tutoring in the schools by trained project personnel

The majority of the tutors were male student-athletes who were having difficulty in their university classes (also scored low in a reading test) and were strongly encouraged to take the class by the Men's Athletic Department. Other students self-selected into the class and included other student-athletes (including female student-athletes) as well as nonstudent-athletes. The tutors were mainly African American, with a few Hispanic and Anglo tutors.

lessons include (a) rereading familiar books, (b) word study, (c) writing, and (d)
reading a new book[¬e]"']

['Page 9:
[¬s]"Pre-service teachers pursuing degrees at a local university received training as literacy tutors and delivered the tutoring lessons three times a week for a period of 10 weeks"
"Tutor training took place
as a part of a semester-long reading assessment and instruction course that pre-service
teacher candidates complete in partial fulfillment of the requirements of a Bachelor’s
degree in elementary education. This course is designed to help pre-service teachers
strengthen expertise in identifying students’ reading difficulties and designing instruction
aimed at helping students improve their early grade reading skills. The course includes a
supervised field experience, which requires teacher candidates to apply what they learn
about reading assessment and instruction in a local elementary school setting.[¬e]"']
['Page 3:\n[¬s]" first-grade teachers and a Title I reading teacher [¬e]"']

int_who_info: Tutors were recruited via ads placed in the school newsletters and by contacts with counselors at local high schools. Of the original group recruited in October, four tutors were parents, one tutor was a grandparent, one tutor was a community-college student, and four tutors were high school students. Tutors were paid a nominal hourly wage for training and tutoring. Tutor turnover during the year was 30%.

int_who_ht:
['Page 4:
[¬s]"Nineteen paraprofessional
tutors hired and paid by their respec\xad
tive schools were randomly assigned
to treatments by research staff prior to
training; however, four tutors' treat\xad
ment assignments were switched prior
to training due to conflicts between
the training schedule and the tutors'
schedules.[¬e]"']

['Page 4:
[¬s]"A total of 22 tutors were recruited from their school
communities. Tutors’ educational levels, general tutoring experi\xad
ence, and experience working with second and third graders var\xad
ied. All but one had already been working at the school as either
an instructional assistant or tutor. Prior to the study, tutors had a
range of 0 to 11 years of reading tutoring experience (M = 3.6
years, SD = 3.43), and all tutors had at least a high school diploma
(15 had bachelor’s degrees, 5 with teaching certificates). The
average educational attainment of tutors in this study matched the
paraeducator competency requirements under the No Child Left
Behind Act of 2001. Most tutors (91%) were female, and six
(27%) were of minority heritage.[¬e]"']

['Page 6:
[¬s]"Tutors"
"ranged in
educational level from high school to master’s degree, with a modal level of some
college or vocational education (43%)[¬e]"']

['Page 49:
[¬s]"As an incentive to promote the tutoring initiative, the America Reads Challenge legislation stipulated that 100% of the funding for tutors at participating universities would be provided by Federal Work-Study Grants."
"Tutors were selected from the pool of Federal Work-Study applicants based on their experience and interest in working with young struggling readers. Rutgers students with previous tutoring or teaching experience and those enrolled in education related courses were given a priority. Tutors and graduate assistants were paid by the hour from funding provided by their Federal Work-Study Grants."
"To adequately meet the needs of the program,
thirty-five undergraduates were selected as tutors and 12 graduate students were
selected to assist in mentoring and supervising the tutors and in collecting
experimental data.[¬e]"']
